formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Utilization U (Tinseth): $$ U = 1.65 \\times 0.000125^{(SG - 1)} \\times \\frac{1 - e^{-0.04\\,t}}{4.15} $$ IBU per addition: $$ \\mathrm{IBU} = \\frac{\\mathrm{AA} \\times W_{g} \\times 1000 \\times U \\times F_{form} \\times F_{wp}}{V_{L}} $$ Where: SG = specific gravity of the boil/wort (e.g., 1.050). t = boil time in minutes for the addition. AA = alpha-acid fraction (e.g., 0.10 for 10%). W_g = hop weight in grams. V_L = batch volume in liters. F_form = pellet factor (1.10 for pellet, 1.00 for whole leaf). F_wp = whirlpool temperature factor (0.02â€“1.0; see glossary).

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Bigness factor: $1.65 \\times 0.000125^{(1.050 - 1)} \\approx 1.65 \\times 0.000125^{0.050}$ Time factor at 60 min: $\\frac{1 - e^{-0.04 \\cdot 60}}{4.15}$; at 10 min: $\\frac{1 - e^{-0.04 \\cdot 10}}{4.15}$ Compute U for each, multiply by AA, weight, pellet factor (1.10), divide by 20 L, then sum IBUs.
